intro: Euchroma angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved echium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Euchroma angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
